thread.title: A South End shop is making 'highly inappropriate' doughnuts for Valentine's Day
thread.title_full: A South End shop is making 'highly inappropriate' doughnuts for Valentine's Day

title: A South End shop is making 'highly inappropriate' doughnuts for Valentine's Day
text:
Blackbird Doughnuts is adding a lot of spice to their line-up on Valentine’s Day.
The doughnut shop posted an X-rated photo on Instagram featuring sweet treats — and a lot of blurry, censored text — decorated with spicy sayings. Here’s the most PG example:
We are closed today, but you still have time to order your Valentine's doughnuts. email us at orders@blackbirddoughnuts.com so that you too get the chance to be naughty.
A photo posted by Blackbird Doughnuts (@blackbirddoughnuts) on Feb 13, 2017 at 4:25am PST
Anna Roine, the head chef at Blackbird, said this is the bakery’s second year featuring “dirty doughnuts” for Valentine’s Day.
“Last year we were offering boxes with custom sweetheart messages on them. We thought people would write ‘be mine’ or ‘true love’ on them,” she said. “One person wanted suggestive things on their doughnuts.”
The Blackbird staff loved the idea, so they started writing the messages themselves.
“A good amount of last year’s Valentine’s Day was spent making trays of doughnuts with lude comments on them,” Roine said.
Roine said the majority of doughnut orders this year are for sweet nothings, but naughty ones are coming in by the dozens, too. “We’ll write whatever you want, as long as it fits on a doughnut,” she said.
we are closed today but still taking v-day orders up until 6p. email us. orders@blackbirddoughnuts.com
A photo posted by Blackbird Doughnuts (@blackbirddoughnuts) on Feb 13, 2017 at 8:20am PST
As for the Valentine’s display at the shop, Roine said they will decorate a doughnut with “XXX” written on it in case any children come in.
“If you’re old enough, we’ll show you a tray and you can pick your message,” said Roine.
The Valentine’s Day doughnuts are available for order by the half ($20) and full dozen ($40). All kinds of doughnuts will be available for individual purchase for $3.
(Blackbird Doughnuts, 492 Tremont St., Boston; blackbirddoughnuts.com )
